pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:0.5.eng: 83. The training rule on royal compounds

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo uyyānapālaṃ āṇāpesi—“gaccha, bhaṇe, uyyānaṃ sodhehi. Uyyānaṃ gamissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.2.eng: King Pasenadi of Kosala told his park-keeper, “Go and clean up the park; I’ll be going there.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, devā”ti kho so uyyānapālo rañño pasenadissa kosalassa paṭissutvā uyyānaṃ sodhento addasa bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisinnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.3.eng: “Yes, sir.” While cleaning the park, he saw the Buddha seated at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.4.pli: Disvāna yena rājā pasenadi kosalo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ etadavoca—“suddhaṃ, deva, uyyānaṃ. Api ca bhagavā tattha nisinno”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.4.eng: He then went to King Pasenadi and said, “The park is clean, sir, but the Buddha is sitting there.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.6.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo uyyānaṃ gantvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami. Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako bhagavantaṃ payirupāsanto nisinno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.6.eng: The king went to the park and approached the Buddha, but just then a lay follower was seated there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.7.pli: Addasā kho rājā pasenadi kosalo taṃ upāsakaṃ bhagavantaṃ payirupāsantaṃ nisinnaṃ. Disvāna bhīto aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.7.eng: When the king saw him, he became fearful and stopped.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.8.pli: Atha kho rañño pasenadissa kosalassa etadahosi—“nārahatāyaṃ puriso pāpo hotuṃ, yathā bhagavantaṃ payirupāsatī”ti. Yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.8.eng: But he considered, “This man isn’t likely to be bad, since he’s visiting the Buddha,” and so he approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.9.pli: Atha kho so upāsako bhagavato gāravena rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ neva abhivādesi na paccuṭṭhāsi. Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo anattamano ahosi—“kathañhi nāmāyaṃ puriso mayi āgate neva abhivādessati na paccuṭṭhessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.9.eng: But when that lay follower, because of his respect for the Buddha, neither bowed down to the king nor stood up for him, the king became annoyed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.10.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ anattamanaṃ viditvā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ etadavoca—“eso kho, mahārāja, upāsako bahussuto āgatāgamo kāmesu vītarāgo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.10.eng: The Buddha realized what was happening and said to the king, “Great king, this lay follower is learned, a master of the tradition, and he’s free from sensual desire.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.11.pli: Atha kho rañño pasenadissa kosalassa etadahosi—“nārahatāyaṃ upāsako orako hotuṃ, bhagavāpi imassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.11.eng: The king thought, “This lay follower doesn’t deserve to be in an inferior position, since even the Buddha praises him.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.12.pli: Taṃ upāsakaṃ etadavoca—“vadeyyāsi, upāsaka, yena attho”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.12.eng: And he said to that lay follower, “Please say what you want.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.13.comm: Suṭṭhu, devāti, literally, “It is good, sir.” The exact contextual meaning is not clear to me.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi. Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.14.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened King Pasenadi with a teaching, after which the king got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo uparipāsādavaragato hoti. Addasā kho rājā pasenadi kosalo taṃ upāsakaṃ rathikāya chattapāṇiṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.15.eng: Soon afterwards King Pasenadi was up in his finest stilt house, when he saw that lay follower walking along the street, holding a sunshade.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.16.pli: Disvāna pakkosāpetvā etadavoca—“tvaṃ kira, upāsaka, bahussuto āgatāgamo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.16.eng: He summoned him and said, “You are a learned Buddhist, a master of the tradition.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.17.pli: Sādhu, upāsaka, amhākaṃ itthāgāraṃ dhammaṃ vācehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.18.pli: “Yamahaṃ, deva, jānāmi ayyānaṃ vāhasā, ayyāva devassa itthāgāraṃ dhammaṃ vācessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.1.18.eng: “Whatever I know, sir, I know because of the monks. They should teach the harem.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo—“saccaṃ kho upāsako āhā”ti yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.1.eng: Knowing that the lay follower was right, the king went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.2.pli: “sādhu, bhante, bhagavā ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpetu yo amhākaṃ itthāgāraṃ dhammaṃ vācessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.2.eng: “Sir, please ask a monk to teach my harem.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rājānaṃ pasenadiṃ kosalaṃ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi …pe… padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.3.eng: The Buddha then instructed, inspired, and gladdened King Pasenadi with a teaching, after which the king got up from his seat, paid his respects as before, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—“tenahānanda, rañño itthāgāraṃ dhammaṃ vācehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.4.eng: Soon afterwards, the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda, “Well then, Ānanda, teach the king’s harem.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā kālena kālaṃ pavisitvā rañño itthāgāraṃ dhammaṃ vāceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.5.eng: “Yes, sir.” And from time to time he would enter the harem and teach.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena rañño pasenadissa kosalassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.6.eng: Then, after robing up in the morning, Ānanda took his bowl and robe and went to King Pasenadi’s house.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo mallikāya deviyā saddhiṃ sayanagato hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.7.eng: On that occasion the king was in bed with Queen Mallikā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.8.pli: Addasā kho mallikā devī āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ dūratova āgacchantaṃ. Disvāna sahasā vuṭṭhāsi; pītakamaṭṭhaṃ dussaṃ pabhassittha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.8.eng: The queen saw Ānanda coming and she quickly got up, but her burnished golden dressing gown fell off.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando tatova paṭinivattitvā ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.9.eng: Ānanda turned around right there and returned to the monastery. And he told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā ānando pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito rañño antepuraṃ pavisissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.11.eng: “How could Venerable Ānanda enter the royal compound without first being announced?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, ānanda, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito rañño antepuraṃ pavisasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.12.eng: “Is it true, Ānanda, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, ānanda, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito rañño antepuraṃ pavisissasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.2.18.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.1.eng: “Monks, there are these ten dangers of entering a royal compound.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.1.comm: For the rendering of antepura as “royal compound”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, rājā mahesiyā saddhiṃ nisinno hoti, tattha bhikkhu pavisati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.3.eng: It may be that a monk enters where the king is sitting with his queen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.4.pli: Mahesī vā bhikkhuṃ disvā sitaṃ pātukaroti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.4.eng: The queen smiles when she sees the monk

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.5.pli: Bhikkhu vā mahesiṃ disvā sitaṃ pātukaroti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.5.eng: or the monk smiles when he sees the queen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.7.eng: ‘Surely they’ve done it, or they’re going to.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.9.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā bahukicco bahukaraṇīyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.9.eng: Again, because the king is very busy,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.10.eng: he does not remember having slept with a certain woman,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.11.eng: yet she becomes pregnant because of that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.13.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati aññatra pabbajitena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.16.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure aññataraṃ ratanaṃ nassati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.16.eng: Again, a gem disappears from the royal compound.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.18.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati aññatra pabbajitena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.21.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure abbhantarā guyhamantā bahiddhā sambhedaṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.21.eng: Again, secret discussions in the royal compound are spread outside.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.23.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati aññatra pabbajitena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño antepure putto vā pitaraṃ pattheti pitā vā puttaṃ pattheti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26.eng: Again, in the royal compound a father longs for his son, or a son longs for his father.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.26.comm: This may refer to illegitimate offspring, and the monk acting as an informant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.28.pli: ‘na kho idha añño koci pavisati aññatra pabbajitena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.31.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā nīcaṭṭhāniyaṃ ucce ṭhāne ṭhapeti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.32.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.33.eng: ‘The king is close to the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.36.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā uccaṭṭhāniyaṃ nīce ṭhāne ṭhapeti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.37.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.38.eng: ‘The king is close to the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.41.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā akāle senaṃ uyyojeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.41.eng: Again, the king sends out the army at an inappropriate time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.42.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.43.eng: ‘The king is close to the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.46.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rājā kāle senaṃ uyyojetvā antarāmaggato nivattāpeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.46.eng: Again, after sending out the army at an appropriate time, the king orders it to turn back while still en route.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.47.pli: Yesaṃ taṃ amanāpaṃ tesaṃ evaṃ hoti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.48.eng: ‘The king is close to the monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.51.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rañño rājantepuraṃ hatthisammaddaṃ assasammaddaṃ rathasammaddaṃ rajanīyāni rūpasaddagandharasaphoṭṭhabbāni, yāni na pabbajitassa sāruppāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.51.eng: Again, a royal compound is crowded with elephants, horses, and chariots, as well as enticing sights, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangibles that are not suitable for a monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.53.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dasa ādīnavā rājantepurappavesane”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.53.eng: Monks, these are the ten dangers of entering a royal compound.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.54.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.54.eng: Then, after rebuking Ānanda in many ways, the Buddha spoke in dispraise of being difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.55.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.55.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu rañño khattiyassa muddhāvasittassa anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1.eng: ‘If a monk, without first being announced, crosses the threshold to the bedroom of a consecrated aristocrat king, when both the king and the queen are present, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:1.3.56.1.comm: The Pali just says threshold: “The threshold of a consecrated king”. To give the rule a more definitive meaning, I have added “bedroom” from the word commentary below.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6.pli: ubhato sujāto hoti, mātito ca pitito ca saṃsuddhagahaṇiko, yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā akkhitto anupakuṭṭho jātivādena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6.eng: well-born on both his mother’s side and his father’s side, pure in descent, irreproachable and impeccable with respect to birth going back eight generations of male ancestors.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.6.comm: Pitāmashayuga refers to “grandfather generation”, thus a total of eight generations back.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.10.eng: the king has not left the bedroom.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.12.pli: mahesī sayanigharā anikkhantā hoti, ubho vā anikkhantā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.12.eng: the queen has not left the bedroom. Or both have not left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.16.eng: the threshold to the bedroom is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.18.pli: yattha katthaci rañño sayanaṃ paññattaṃ hoti, antamaso sāṇipākāraparikkhittampi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.18.eng: wherever a king’s bed is prepared, even if just enclosed by a cloth screen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.19.eng: Crosses the threshold to the bedroom:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.20.pli: paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ ummāraṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.20.eng: if he crosses the threshold with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.1.21.eng: If he crosses with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.1.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite appaṭisaṃviditasaññī indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.1.eng: If he has not been announced, and he perceives that he has not, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.2.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite vematiko indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.2.eng: If he has not been announced, but he is unsure of it, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.3.pli: Appaṭisaṃvidite paṭisaṃviditasaññī indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.3.eng: If he has not been announced, but he perceives that he has, and he crosses the threshold to the bedroom, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.4.eng: If he has been announced, but he perceives that he has not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.5.eng: If he has been announced, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.2.6.eng: If he has been announced, and he perceives that he has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.3.eng: if it is not an aristocrat king;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.4.eng: if the king has not been consecrated with the aristocratic consecration;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.5.eng: if the king has left the bedroom;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.6.eng: if the queen has left the bedroom;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.8.eng: if it is not a bedroom;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc83:2.3.11.eng: The training rule on royal compounds, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:0.5.eng: 84. The training rule on precious things

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu aciravatiyā nadiyā nahāyati. Aññataropi brāhmaṇo pañcasatānaṃ thavikaṃ thale nikkhipitvā aciravatiyā nadiyā nahāyanto vissaritvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.2.eng: a monk was bathing in the river Aciravatī, when a brahmin, too, came there to bathe. He deposited a bag with five hundred coins on the ground, bathed, forgot about the bag, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.3.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu—“tassāyaṃ brāhmaṇassa thavikā, mā idha nassī”ti aggahesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.3.eng: The monk thought, “This is the bag belonging to that brahmin; it wouldn’t be nice if it got lost,” and he picked it up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.4.pli: Atha kho so brāhmaṇo saritvā turito ādhāvitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—“api me, bho, thavikaṃ passeyyāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.4.eng: Soon the brahmin remembered. He hurried back and asked that monk, “Sir, did you see my bag?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.5.eng: Saying, “I did indeed,” he gave it to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.6.pli: Atha kho tassa brāhmaṇassa etadahosi—“kena nu kho ahaṃ upāyena imassa bhikkhuno puṇṇapattaṃ na dadeyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.6.eng: The brahmin thought, “How can I avoid giving a reward to this monk?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.7.pli: “Na me, bho, pañcasatāni, sahassaṃ me”ti palibundhetvā muñci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.7.eng: And he said, “I didn’t have five hundred coins, I had a thousand!” And he seized hold of that monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu ārāmaṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.8.eng: After being released, that monk went to the monastery and told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.9.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.9.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.10.eng: “How could a monk pick up precious things?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.14.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, ratanaṃ uggahessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.14.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.16.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.16.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.17.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.18.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:1.18.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā ussavo hoti. Manussā alaṅkatappaṭiyattā uyyānaṃ gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards there was a celebration in Sāvatthī. People were going to the park all dressed up,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.3.pli: gāmato nikkhamitvā—“kyāhaṃ karissāmi uyyānaṃ gantvā, yannūnāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ payirupāseyyan”ti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.3.eng: As she was leaving her village, she thought, “What will I do when I get to the park? Why don’t I pay a visit to the Buddha!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.4.pli: ābharaṇaṃ omuñcitvā uttarāsaṅgena bhaṇḍikaṃ bandhitvā dāsiyā adāsi—“handa, je, imaṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ gaṇhāhī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.4.eng: She then removed all her ornaments, bound them in a bundle with her upper robe, and gave it to her slave girl, saying, “Listen, look after this bundle.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.5.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.5.eng: Visākhā then went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi. Atha kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṃsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.6.eng: And the Buddha instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching, after which she got up from her seat, bowed down, circumambulated him with her right side toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.7.pli: Atha kho sā dāsī taṃ bhaṇḍikaṃ vissaritvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.7.eng: And the slave girl left too, forgetting the bundle.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.8.pli: Bhikkhū passitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ. “Tena hi, bhikkhave, uggahetvā nikkhipathā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.8.eng: The monks saw it and told the Buddha. “Well then, monks, pick it up and put it aside.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.9.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.10.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipituṃ—‘yassa bhavissati so harissatī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.10.eng: “Within a monastery, monks, you should pick up precious things or what’s regarded as precious, or have it picked up, and then put it aside with the thought, ‘Whoever owns it will come and get it.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.11.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.11.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā, aññatra ajjhārāmā, uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, except within a monastery, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.13.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:2.13.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kāsīsu janapade anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa kammantagāmo hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.1.eng: At that time the householder Anāthapiṇḍika had a whole village working for him in the country of Kāsi,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.2.pli: Tena ca gahapatinā antevāsī āṇatto hoti—“sace bhadantā āgacchanti, bhattaṃ kareyyāsī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.2.eng: and he had told an apprentice there that if the monks arrive he should make them a meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū kāsīsu janapade cārikaṃ caramānā yena anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa kammantagāmo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.3.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks were wandering in the country of Kāsi, when they came to that village.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.4.pli: Addasā kho so puriso te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante. Disvāna yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū abhivādetvā etadavoca—“adhivāsentu, bhante, ayyā svātanāya gahapatino bhattan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.4.eng: When that man saw them coming, he approached them, bowed, and said, “Venerables, please accept a meal from Anāthapiṇḍika tomorrow.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.5.eng: The monks accepted by remaining silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.6.pli: Atha kho so puriso tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṃ khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ paṭiyādāpetvā kālaṃ ārocāpetvā aṅgulimuddikaṃ omuñcitvā te bhikkhū bhattena parivisitvā—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.6.eng: The following morning, after having various kinds of fine foods prepared, he had the monks informed that it was time for the meal. He removed a ring from his finger and then offered the food to the monks, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.7.pli: “ayyā bhuñjitvā gacchantu, ahampi kammantaṃ gamissāmī”ti aṅgulimuddikaṃ vissaritvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.7.eng: “Venerables, please leave after you’ve eaten. I have to go to work.” And he left, forgetting his ring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.8.pli: Bhikkhū passitvā—“sace mayaṃ gamissāma nassissatāyaṃ aṅgulimuddikā”ti tattheva acchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.8.eng: The monks saw it and said, “If we just go, this ring will be lost,” and so they stayed right there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.9.pli: Atha kho so puriso kammantā āgacchanto te bhikkhū passitvā etadavoca—“kissa, bhante, ayyā idheva acchantī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.9.eng: When that man returned from work, he saw the monks and said to them, “Why are you still here?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū tassa purisassa etamatthaṃ ārocetvā
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.10.eng: And the monks told him what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.11.eng: Those monks then went to Sāvatthī where they told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.12.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.13.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.13.eng: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.14.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipituṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.14.eng: “Within a monastery, monks, or inside a lodging, you should pick up precious things or what’s regarded as precious, or have it picked up, and then put it aside with the thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.15.eng: ‘Whoever owns it will come and get it.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.16.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.16.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.17.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā, aññatra ajjhārāmā vā ajjhāvasathā vā, uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.17.1.eng: ‘If a monk picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, except within a monastery or inside a lodging, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.18.pli: Ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbaṃ—‘yassa bhavissati so harissatī’ti. Ayaṃ tattha sāmīcī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:3.18.eng: If he picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, within a monastery or inside a lodging, he should put it aside with the thought, “Whoever owns it will come and get it.” This is the proper procedure.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.6.pli: muttā maṇi veḷuriyo saṅkho silā pavālaṃ rajataṃ jātarūpaṃ lohitaṅko masāragallaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.6.eng: a pearl, a gem, a beryl, mother-of-pearl, quartz, a coral, silver, gold, a ruby, a cat’s eye.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.6.comm: “Beryl” renders veḷuriya. Sp-ṭ 1.281: Veḷuriyoti vaṁsavaṇṇamaṇi, “The bamboo-colored gem is called veḷuriya.” According to PED veḷuriya is lapis lazuli, which cannot be correct because lapis lazuli is blue.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.8.pli: yaṃ manussānaṃ upabhogaparibhogaṃ, etaṃ ratanasammataṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.8.eng: whatever people regard as valuable or useful—this is called “regarded as precious”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.9.eng: Except within a monastery or inside a lodging:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.10.eng: apart from within a monastery or inside a lodging.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.12.pli: parikkhittassa ārāmassa anto ārāmo, aparikkhittassa upacāro.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.12.eng: if the monastery is enclosed, then within the enclosure. If the monastery is unenclosed, then in the vicinity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.14.pli: parikkhittassa āvasathassa anto āvasatho, aparikkhittassa upacāro.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.14.eng: if the lodging is enclosed, then within the enclosure. If the lodging is unenclosed, then in the vicinity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.16.eng: if he takes hold of it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.18.eng: if he gets someone else to take hold of it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.19.pli: Ratanaṃ vā pana bhikkhunā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipitabbanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.19.eng: If he picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, within a monastery or inside a lodging, he should put it aside:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.20.pli: rūpena vā nimittena vā saññāṇaṃ katvā nikkhipitvā ācikkhitabbaṃ—“yassa bhaṇḍaṃ naṭṭhaṃ so āgacchatū”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.20.eng: after taking note of its appearance or distinguishing marks, he should put it aside, and then make an announcement: “Whoever has lost anything should come.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.21.pli: Sace tattha āgacchati so vattabbo—“āvuso, kīdisaṃ te bhaṇḍan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.21.eng: If anyone comes, they should be told, “Please describe it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.22.pli: Sace rūpena vā nimittena vā sampādeti dātabbaṃ, no ce sampādeti “vicināhi, āvuso”ti vattabbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.22.eng: If they rightly describe its appearance or distinguishing marks, it should be given to them. If they do not, they should be told, “Keep looking.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.23.pli: Tamhā āvāsā pakkamantena ye tattha honti bhikkhū patirūpā, tesaṃ hatthe nikkhipitvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.23.eng: If that monk is leaving that monastery, he should first place that item into the hands of suitable monks there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.24.pli: No ce honti bhikkhū patirūpā, ye tattha honti gahapatikā patirūpā, tesaṃ hatthe nikkhipitvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.1.24.eng: If there are no suitable monks, he should place it into the hands of suitable householders there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.2.pli: ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā ajjhārāme vā ajjhāvasathe vā uggahetvā vā uggahāpetvā vā nikkhipati—“yassa bhavissati so harissatī”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.2.eng: if he picks up something precious or something regarded as precious, or he has it picked up, within a monastery or inside a lodging, and then puts it aside with the thought, “Whoever owns it will come and get it;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.3.pli: ratanasammataṃ vissāsaṃ gaṇhāti, tāvakālikaṃ gaṇhāti, paṃsukūlasaññissa,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.3.eng: if he takes something regarded as precious on trust or he borrows it or he perceives it as discarded;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.3.comm: “Taking on trust” refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.5.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc84:4.2.6.eng: The training rule on precious things, the second, is finished.
